intro: Ischarum dispar, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss in harsh environments. Ischarum dispar is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions.
